column4: Quick question: I'm running gidentd on my ubuntu 8.04 server (yes I haven't upgraded yet) and I would like for it to listen on only one of my IP addresses. The problem is that the gidentd.conf file says that it's just a place holder. Is there no way to change the default behaviour of gidentd and what IP it binds to?
Nobody has any experience with gidentd?
Anymore automated responses you'd like to send my way.
no, you asked if anyone here has experience with gidentd - that's not a properly formed question - what is your issue with gidentd?
I did. If you scrolled up you would see my question. My question is can I bind gidentd to a specific IP address since gidentd.conf says that it's just a place holder.
i'm not sure about that, it's been awhile since i installed it. hrm, i could possibly see..
that's pretty odd, have you searched google at all? now you've got me interested...

Yeah. It defaults to ipv6 (which is fine) and the gidentd.conf file clearly states (this is just a place holder). *shrug* I guess I could find a different identd program. I don't want anything serving on an IP that it's not needed on.
yeah, just saw that... well, i tend to only run gidentd on servers, which is where i tend to place firewalls, so I would just tweak my firewall a bit
I guess I could block it using iptables, but that seems like a bad hack.
if it's a desktop, then i'd do the same there if i had multi-ips
it is, but it gets the job done
i would just deny access to * on port 113 and then open it up to just that ip
